page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Strathnaver Museum - Bettyhill} Strathnaver Museum was opened in 1976. It is housed in the old Church of Farr and a pull-in car park has been provided at the side of the road. The building was last used as a church during the second world war, it then lay empty for many years before being taken over by N.I.S.C. and restored as a museum. The main theme of the Museum is the Strathnaver Clearances. It was from the Farr Church pulpit which can still be seen in the Museum, that eviction notices were read out and the people were told the Evictions had come as a punishment for their sins. Each year about 2,000 people from many countries visit the Museum mainly because of their interest in the Clearances or because their name is "Mackay".
